intro: Aphyllon californicum subsp. grande, commonly known as the large-flowered aphyllon, is a perennial herb native to California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This subspecies is distinguished by its larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other subspecies of Aphyllon.
